title: _act_
author: _act_
content: Some days ago Trump said bitcoin, ether, solana, ripple and cardano will be part of the strategic national reserve. But when I read about what the White House published about the reserve some days ago, only bitcoin is talked about.Or is there something that I got wrong? If only bitcoin is talked about, is it good that Trump talked about those altcoins but not later part of the reserve? I think it is market manipulation.But if we think about it, bitcoin supposed to be the only coin in the strategy reserve. It is the true cryptocurrency unlike the coins that are all centralized or used as a means of gambling.

comments.author: FortuneFollower
comments.body: Because BTC is the biggest and the most anticipated of them all.All the rest are there just to be something that would be more controlled, imo.

comments.author: BenCodie
comments.created_time: March 10, 2025, 12:30:08 PMLast edit: March 10, 2025, 12:56:42 PM by BenCodie
comments.body: It's a confusing time - digital asset stockpile, national bitcoin reserve, the executive order, plus all the fluff on social media platforms...lots of posts and media out there propagating overstated things that simply aren't true about the recent news. Lots of noise to sift through...TLDR:Digital asset stockpile includes bitcoin and altcoins, national bitcoin reserve just includes bitcoin, both of which currently only represent what the US own and will not sell. Nothing about buying yet. Extended summary:Without overstating anything, here is my understanding in the context of your post and in a bit more expanded summary: The digital assets stockpile and the national bitcoin reserve are two different things...it includes (afaik) what the US Government already hold and the recent executive order makes it official as the national reserve and stockpile (what they will not sell). They can sell existing things to buy Bitcoin/other digital assets (including gold reserves or other assets), though nothing currently permits taxpayer money/any budget that costs the tax payer money to be used to buy Bitcoin or digital assets. The proposal to be kept an eye on is the Strategic Bitcoin Reserve legislation by Senator Lummis which is not expected to pass for some time (according to some members, could still be years away). This would permit the government to allocate budget to buying Bitcoin (specifically up to 200,000 BTC per year).If something above needs correcting, please directly quote what is incorrect and correct it (for the sake of clearly understanding what is wrong with the current summary and to be able to easily improve it)!

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on March 10, 2025, 12:18:10 PMSome days ago Trump said bitcoin, ether, solana, ripple and cardano will be part of the strategic national reserve. But when I read about what the White House published about the reserve some days ago, only bitcoin is talked about.Or is there something that I got wrong? If only bitcoin is talked about, is it good that Trump talked about those altcoins but not later part of the reserve? I think it is market manipulation.But if we think about it, bitcoin supposed to be the only coin in the strategy reserve. It is the true cryptocurrency unlike the coins that are all centralized or used as a means of gambling.For now, there have been only speculations on whether bitcoin or altcoins are to comprise the investment, it is clear that the most social media are taking up crypto and as you have mentioned the few altcoins in consideration, which is also telling us the plan ahead for them to invest in bitcoin and some few selected altcoins later.From the other end, should we assumed that the strategic crypto investment are only referred to the confiscated bitcoin they hold in their possession from all manner of illegals forms, serving as seized bitcoin in their disposal turning to be their main target investment.Am not sure on which of the two sides Trump is referring to or coming from, maybe some more experienced members like @franky1 or @pooya87 and many more experienced members could throw more light here on this regard.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: BenCodie on March 10, 2025, 12:30:08 PMIt's a confusing time - digital asset stockpile, national bitcoin reserve, the executive order, plus all the fluff on social media platforms...lots of posts and media out there propagating overstated things that simply aren't true about the recent news. Lots of noise to sift through...Confusion, fluff, false news, propagating overstated, lots of noise... It sounds to me like Pi coin (or whatever it is) will be the chosen altcoin currency for the US reserve.  Of course, I'm being sarcastic. But looking at what Trump has been doing these past few months, I guess no one will be surprised by his decisions.

comments.author: adultcrypto
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on March 10, 2025, 12:18:10 PMSome days ago Trump said bitcoin, ether, solana, ripple and cardano will be part of the strategic national reserve. But when I read about what the White House published about the reserve some days ago, only bitcoin is talked about.Or is there something that I got wrong? If only bitcoin is talked about, is it good that Trump talked about those altcoins but not later part of the reserve? I think it is market manipulation.But if we think about it, bitcoin supposed to be the only coin in the strategy reserve. It is the true cryptocurrency unlike the coins that are all centralized or used as a means of gambling.You did not get anything wrong, I think there is confusion somewhere either with Trump finger or something because he was too fast to send out the information about the altcoins. I believe it took a reminder from one of the aids before he even remembered to add bitcoin and ethereum. Maybe he is calmer now after being spoken to be his associates, the reason they have now gone back to bitcoin. We shall see in the coming days or weeks what will actually make it to the crypto reserve because there is still so much confusion about the whole thing.

comments.author: Reatim
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on March 10, 2025, 12:18:10 PMSome days ago Trump said bitcoin, ether, solana, ripple and cardano will be part of the strategic national reserve. But when I read about what the White House published about the reserve some days ago, only bitcoin is talked about.Or is there something that I got wrong? yes back then all trump talked about was bitcoin and so everyone thought that he was only interested in bitcoin it wasnt such a bad thing anyway since to a lot of crypto enthusiasts bitcoin is the most important cryptocurrency and the best one so i did not really care back then if altcoins were not involved in trump's plans but it is still good that he is now exploring more in crypto QuoteIf only bitcoin is talked about, is it good that Trump talked about those altcoins but not later part of the reserve? I think it is market manipulation.he did say that those altcoins are to be part of the reserve it could be market manipulation but if it is it is not working very well hence why i do not think it is but we will see if trump does not fulfill his promises then it is market manipulation what he is doing now

comments.author: macson
comments.body: I think so too. Trump originally said it was a "crypto reserve" consisting of 5 cryptocurrencies, but on Friday he used an executive order to launch a "bitcoin reserve" consisting of bitcoins they already had that were seized from criminals. But it can't be called a national reserve because the government can't invest in it regularly. So I'm a bit confused by this myself, and see it more as a political game and manipulation by Trump.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on March 10, 2025, 12:18:10 PMSome days ago Trump said bitcoin, ether, solana, ripple and cardano will be part of the strategic national reserve. But when I read about what the White House published about the reserve some days ago, only bitcoin is talked about.Or is there something that I got wrong? If only bitcoin is talked about, is it good that Trump talked about those altcoins but not later part of the reserve? I think it is market manipulation.But if we think about it, bitcoin supposed to be the only coin in the strategy reserve. It is the true cryptocurrency unlike the coins that are all centralized or used as a means of gambling.Well, maybe you are actually in the wrong because according to what I read online, it was stated that Bitcoin has been accepted and that the US government will create a reserve with it.. But moving further, Trump and the whitehouse are also looking or considering taking Altcoins in the top 6 or 7 according to their marketcap ranking and making a strategic reserve of this alts as well, this has not been concluded, it was only a suggestion or idea which I believe, Trump and his government as well as the whitehouse are still discussing about to arrive at a final decision.There was not any market manipulation, the only issue is that alot of people fail to verify informations themselves before making a decision, they tend to listen and depend on media which twist information at times.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on March 10, 2025, 12:18:10 PMIf only bitcoin is talked about, is it good that Trump talked about those altcoins but not later part of the reserve? I think it is market manipulation.I have always cared less about all of those noise because I just had that old impression that Trump is not Bitcoin friendly, and there's no benefit of doubt even with all his talks about Bitcoin. To him, he just used Bitcoin to pave way for himself so he could become the president because he knew he would have lots of support. Mentioning other altcoins can just be part of the game to manipulate the market.

comments.author: Sanitough
comments.body: Are you really surprised? Trump has been manipulating the market for a long time, it’s just that not everyone notices. Even before his announcement, there were already reports that his son knew the market would turn bullish, so aside from manipulation, there’s clearly some insider trading going on too.And about the crypto reserve, the phrase "they talk about" makes it sound like it’s still just a rumor. So instead of jumping to conclusions, why not wait for the final publication to see if altcoins are actually included or if it’s just Bitcoin?

comments.author: Zoomic
comments.body: Quote from: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange on March 10, 2025, 01:59:54 PMQuote from: _act_ on March 10, 2025, 12:18:10 PMIf only bitcoin is talked about, is it good that Trump talked about those altcoins but not later part of the reserve? I think it is market manipulation.I have always cared less about all of those noise because I just had that old impression that Trump is not Bitcoin friendly, and there's no benefit of doubt even with all his talks about Bitcoin. To him, he just used Bitcoin to pave way for himself so he could become the president because he knew he would have lots of support. Mentioning other altcoins can just be part of the game to manipulate the market. I used to think the same way about Trump and his supposed interest in Bitcoin. However, would he really go to the extent of hosting a crypto summit and including Bitcoin in the discussion if he had no interest in it? If he had no real intention, perhaps he would have remained silent, allowing us to realize on our own that we had been used and dumped. Maybe you're right, he could just be manipulating the market. Still, let's give him some time to make a solid decision so we can truly understand his intentions for the crypto community. If he is merely playing with our intellect, or are we the ones expecting everything to happen too quickly?

comments.author: Odusko
comments.body: Well, the United States is talking about having a cryptocurrency reserve and not gambling with the national wealth, I don't blame Trump for mentioning only Bitcoin and we should not limit our scope of understanding of his statement to mean Bitcoin alone, but all other cryptocurrencies that the state fines on to put tax players money on, but note that Bitcoin is going to occupy the center stage of the whole thing, and for sure it will means other coins like Ethereum a d carbonado that you mentioned.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on March 10, 2025, 12:18:10 PM~Maybe later? I mean I reckon Bitcoin was always the priority especially since they had all those confiscated Bitcoin that they had and haven't sold/released into the market yet. Assuming that Trump is speaking the truth, other alts would probably be a followup on the reserve when they decide how Bitcoin does as one. Especially since they aren't doing any plans of buying crypto yet, only those confiscated, so yeah. The amount they have (idrk how much they have) might also be a factor in stopping them from immediately including alts in the nationa reserve.

It is the true cryptocurrency unlike the coins that are all centralized or used as a means of gambling.Trump has zero value on his words. What he says, changes day by day. So I won't be surprised if the altcoins are dropped from his plan of national reserve. Because there were a couple of altcoins in his plan earlier. However, if these have been dropped, that makes sense too! Bitcoin is the biggest cryptocurrency as per the market size so I don't think any other cryptos are needed in reality.

comments.author: Franctoshi
comments.body: A lot of confusion in the space and I'm still trying to understand what the government is up to with including these altcoins, we never expected altcoins like Solana, ripple, Cardano to be among the list .....Thus, they coined the name Bitcoin strategic reserve, I do think there is a shift to what was initially processed plan to the Bitcoin strategic, and it's crystal clear that some developers of these altcoins lobbied for their coins to get included in the crypto strategic reserve. Therefore, manipulation has indeed taken place and a lot of confusion in the market that we're seeing it reflecting in the price fluctuations lately.

comments.author: Odusko
comments.body: Quote from: Franctoshi on March 10, 2025, 04:09:43 PMA lot of confusion in the space and I'm still trying to understand what the government is up to with including these altcoins, we never expected altcoins like Solana, ripple, Cardano to be among the list .....Thus, they coined the name Bitcoin strategic reserve, I do think there is a shift to what was initially processed plan to the Bitcoin strategic, and it's crystal clear that some developers of these altcoins lobbied for their coins to get included in the crypto strategic reserve. Therefore, manipulation has indeed taken place and a lot of confusion in the market that we're seeing it reflecting in the price fluctuations lately. For me, there is nothing like confusion with the United States Bitcoin reserve policy because it avoids all confusion that the president decides to focus on Bitcoin alone instead of spreading their focus and that will lead to the confusion that you mentioned, the United States president is Smart enough not to have mentioned altcoins join the crypto reserve because of the risk that comes with coins aside from Bitcoin, so let no one speak about confusion in all of this since it a clear case of smart national reserve.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Why is anyone surprised that the Great Grey Bully is talking about altcoins in national reserves? The people behind these projects are some of his donors, and it is no secret that these same people were guests at his residence even before he became president. Until people understand that this is primarily about business, and less about politics - then it will be clear to them that whoever paid for the ticket has their place at the table.https://finance.yahoo.com/news/trump-meets-top-ripple-executives-123025494.htmlhttps://99bitcoins.com/news/cardano-founder-charles-hoskinson-confirms-plans-to-collaborate-with-u-s-government-under-donald-trump/

comments.author: Mia Chloe
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on March 10, 2025, 12:18:10 PMSome days ago Trump said bitcoin, ether, solana, ripple and cardano will be part of the strategic national reserve. But when I read about what the White House published about the reserve some days ago, only bitcoin is talked about.Or is there something that I got wrong?To start with I won't even buy the idea at first that the US will actually implement altcoins in their reserve this is because of what we see everyday on the general altcoin market and how they are easily manipulated. The US government isn't actually blind to all these things so they should be able to tell that a long term currency is suitable for a reserve.This could probably be another news to tear up FOMO in the altcoin market that will anchor a massive manipulation.
